Post._content:
awkgrepsedawkawk
awk3: awknawkgawkgawkgawkAWKGNU

#### 

> awk {pattern + action} {filenames}

patternAWKaction({})pattern

#### 

awk

##### 

> awk [-F  field-separator]  'commands'  input-file(s)

commands awk[-F] input-file(s) 
awk-F

##### shell

awkawkawk

> shell#!/bin/sh
  #!/bin/awk

##### awk

> awk -f awk-script-file input-file(s)

-fawk-script-fileawkinput-file(s)

#### 

1. 5

  ```
  last -n 5 | awk '{print $1}'
  ```
  > awk'\n'$0,$1,$nn""  "[tab]",$1$3ip,

2. /etc/passwd

  ```
  cat /etc/passwd | awk -F':' '{print $1}'
  ```

  > awk+action`action{print $1}`
    -F`:`

3. /etc/passwdshell,shelltab

  ```
  cat /etc/passwd | awk -F':' '{print $1"\t"$7}'
  ```

4. /etc/passwdshell,shell,name,shell,"blue,/bin/nosh"

  ```
  cat /etc/passwd | awk -F':' 'BEGIN{print "name,shell"} {print $1","$7} END{print "blue,/bin/nosh"}' 
  ```

  > awkBEGIN/n$0,$1,$nn,actionEND

5. /etc/passwdroot

  ```
  cat /etc/passwd | awk -F':' '/root/'
  ```

  > patternpattern(root)action(action)
    root: `awk -F: '/^root/' /etc/passwd`

6. /etc/passwdrootshell

  ```
  cat /etc/passwd | awk -F: '/root/{print $7}'
  ```

#### awk

awk

|||
|:---:|:---|
|ARGC||
|ARGV||
|ENVIRON||
|FILENAME|awk|
|FNR||
|FS| -F|
|NF||
|NR||
|OFS||
|ORS||
|RS||

##### 

1. /etc/passwd:

  ```
  awk -F':' '{print "filename: " FILENAME ", linenumber: " NR ", columns: " NF ", linecontent: " $0}' /etc/passwd
  ```

#### printprintf
awkprintprintf
print
printfcprintf,,printf

> 1

```
  awk -F':' '{printf("filename: %10s, linenumber: %s, columns: %s, linecon
tent: %s\n", FILENAME, NR, NF, $0)}' /etc/passwd
```

#### awk

##### 

awkawk

1. /etc/passwd

  ```
  awk 'BEGIN{count=0} {count++} END{print "the number of users is ",count}' /etc/passwd
  ```

2. 

  ```
  ls -l | awk 'BEGIN{size=0} {size+=$5;} END{print "[end]size is ",size}'
  ```

##### 

awkC

> if (expression) {
    statement;
    statement;
    ... ...
  }



> if (expression) {
    statement;
  } else {
    statement2;
  }



> if (expression) {
    statement1;
  } else if (expression1) {
    statement2;
  } else {
    statement3;
  }

1. ,4096

  ```
  ls -l | awk 'BEGIN{size=0} {if($5==4096){size+=$5}} END{print "the size of file is ",size}'
  ```

##### 

awkCwhiledo/whileforbreakcontinueC

##### 

awk(key)key/valuehashhashawkawk

1. /etc/passwd

  ```
  awk -F':' 'BEGIN{count=0;} {name[count]=$1;count++} END{for(i=0;i<NR;i++){print i, name[i]}}' /etc/passwd
  ```


#### 

1. /etc/passwdab

  ```
  awk '$1~/^(a|b)/{print $0}' /etc/passwd | sort
  ```

  > `~``$1`

2. 

  ```
  cat /etc/services | awk -F'[ /]+' '$1~/^(ssh|ftp|https)/{print $1,$2}'| uniq
  ```

3. 

  ```
  awk 'BEGIN{count=0} {if($0==""){count++}} END{print count}' filename
  
  awk 'BEGIN{count=0} /^$/{count++} END{print count}' filename
  ```

4. 

  ```
  awk -F'/' '{array[$3]++}END{for(key in array){print key,array[key]}}' filename
  ```

Post._content:
sedpattern spacesed Sed

#### 
sed [-nefri] command 

#### 
-n(silent) sed STDIN`-n`sed()
-esed
-fsed`-f filename` filename sed 
-rsed()
-i 

#### 
aa()
ccn1,n2
dd
ii()
pp sed -n 
s

#### 
##### 

```
[root@zyj shell]# sed '1d' filename              # 
[root@zyj shell]# sed '$d' filename              #
[root@zyj shell]# sed '1,2d' filename            #
[root@zyj shell]# sed '2,$d' filename            #
```

##### 

```
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '1p' filename           # 
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '$p' filename           #
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '1,2p' filename         #
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '2,$p' filename         #
```

##### 

```
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '/centos/p' filename  #centos
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '/\$/p' filename      #$\
```

##### 

```
[root@zyj shell]# sed '1a drink tea' filename   #"drink tea"
[root@zyj shell]# sed '1,3a drink tea' filename #"drink tea"
[root@zyj shell]# sed '1a drink\ncoffee' filename #\n
```

##### 

```
[root@zyj shell]# sed '1c Hi' filename          #Hi
[root@zyj shell]# sed '1,2c Hi' filename        #Hi
```

##### 

> 
  sed 's///g'   ()

```
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '/centos/p' filename | sed 's/centos/redhat/g'    #centosredhat
[root@zyj shell]# sed -n '/centos/p' filename | sed 's/centos//g'          #centos
```

##### 

```
[root@zyj shell]# sed -i '$a bye' filename   #filenamede "bye"
[root@localhost ruby] # sed -n '2,$p' ab        #
```

#### 

1. ip addrip

  ```
  [root@zyj shell]# ip addr|sed -nr 's/.*inet (.*)\/24.*$/\1/gp'
  192.168.17.131
  ```

2. /etc/passwd

  ```
  cat /etc/passwd | sed -nr 's/(.*)(:x.*:)(.*$)/\3\2\1/gp'
  ```

### NEXT
> 

https://github.com/iissnan/hexo-theme-next

> 

```
$ cd hexo
$ ls
_config.yml  node_modules  package.json  public  scaffolds  source  themes
$ mkdir themes/next
$ curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/iissnan/hexo-theme-next/releases/latest | grep tarball_url | cut -d '"' -f 4 | wget -i - -O- | tar -zx -C themes/next --strip-components=1
```

### NEXT

> `_config.yml``/root/blog``_config.yml``/root/blog/themes/next`

```
$ ls /root/blog/
_config.yml  node_modules  public     source
db.json      package.json  scaffolds  themes

$ ls /root/blog/themes/next/
bower.json   gulpfile.coffee  layout   package.json  README.md  source
_config.yml  languages        LICENSE  README.cn.md  scripts    test
```




### 

> menuabout#

```
menu:
  home: /
  #tags: /tags/ || tags
  categories: /categories/
  archives: /archives/
  about: /about/
  #schedule: /schedule/ || calendar
  #sitemap: /sitemap.xml || sitemap
  #commonweal: /404/ || heartbeat
```

> sourcecategoriesindex.md

```
$ cd /root/blog/source
$ mkdir categories/
$ vim index.md
```

> 

```
---
title: 
date: 
type: "categories"
comments: false
---
```

> 

```
---
title: Hello World
categories: 
- test
---
```

### 

>   next/layout/_layout.swig
`</body>`(`</head>`)

```
{% if theme.canvas_nest %}
<script type="text/javascript" src="//cdn.bootcss.com/canvas-nest.js/1.0.0/canvas-nest.min.js"></script>
{% endif %}
```

> canvas_nesttrue

```
canvas_nest: true
```

### 

> `/themes/next/languages/zh_Hans.yml`post

```
post:
  updated: 
```

> `/themes/next/_config.yml`

```
updated_at: true
```

> 

```
modified:
```

### 
#### hexo-generator-search

> 

```
npm install hexo-generator-search --save
```

> 

```
npm install hexo-generator-searchdb --save
```

#### 

> 

```
search:
  path: search.xml
  field: post
  format: html
  limit: 10000
```

> local_searchenabletrue

```
local_search:
  enable: true
```

### github

#### Github



#### Repository
RepositoryGithubpchad321Repositorypchad321.github.io

#### 

1. RepositoryRepositoryhttps://github.com/pchad321/pchad321.github.io.git

2. 

  ```
  deploy:
    type: git
    repo: https://github.com/pchad321/pchad321.github.io.git
    branch: master
    message: 'updated at:{{now("YYYY-MM-DD HH/mm/ss")}}'

  ```

#### SSH keys

1. git

  ```
  git config --global user.email "you@example.com"
  git config --global user.name "Your Name"
  ```

2. SSH

  ```
  # -Cgithub
  ssh-keygen -t rsa -C you@126.com

  # 
  ```

3. SSHgithub

  ```
  less ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
  ```

  > githubSSH and GPG keys

4. 

  

  ```
  ssh -T git@github.com
  ```

  > 

5. github

  ```
  hexo generate
  hexo deploy
  ```

  > `ERROR Deployer not found: git`

  ```
  npm install --save hexo-deployer-git
  ```

#### HexoGithub



```
$ git init
$ git remote add origin git@github.com:username/username.github.io.git
$ git add .
$ git commit -m "blog"
$ git push origin master:Hexo-Blog
```



```

$ git commit -m "blog"
$ git push origin master:Hexo-Blog
```


## ip
`/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0`()

```
DEVICE=eth0 #
BOOTPROTO=static #IPstatic
ONBOOT=yes
DNS1=114.114.114.114
HWADDR=00:07:E9:05:E8:B4 #
IPADDR=192.168.17.133 #ip
NETMASK=255.255.255.0 
GATEWAY=192.168.17.2
```
->->VMnet8

> `ifcfg-enoxxxxxxx``grub`
vim /etc/default/grub
`GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX``"net.ifnames=0 biosdevname=0"`
`grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg`


## 

```
$ useradd apache

$ passwd apache

$ visudo 

$ /root

$ yyp
```

## apache
```
yum install httpd httpd-devel

#apache
systemctl start httpd.service

#apache
systemctl stop httpd.service

#
systemctl enable httpd.service

#
systemctl stop firewalld.service

#
systemctl disable firewalld.service

#apache/var/www/htmlindex.html
echo apache133 > index.html
```

## Nginx

### nginx

1. root

2. /usr/local/src

3. Nginxopensslpcrezlib

  ```
  wget http://nginx.org/download/nginx-1.12.2.tar.gz
  wget https://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-fips-2.0.16.tar.gz
  wget ftp://ftp.csx.cam.ac.uk/pub/software/programming/pcre/pcre-8.40.tar.gz
  wget http://www.zlib.net/zlib-1.2.11.tar.gz
  ```

4. c++

  ```
  yum install gcc-c++
  ```

5. openssl

  ```
  tar zxvf openssl-fips-2.0.16.tar.gz 
  cd openssl-fips-2.0.16/
  ./config
  make && make install
  ```

6. pcre

  ```
  tar zxvf pcre-8.40.tar.gz 
  cd pcre-8.40/
  ./configure
  make && make install
  ```

7. zlib

  ```
  tar zxvf zlib-1.2.11.tar.gz 
  cd zlib-1.2.11/
  ./configure
  make && make install
  ```

8. Nginx

  ```
  tar zxvf nginx-1.12.2.tar.gz 
  cd nginx-1.12.2/
  ./configure
  make && make install
  ```

9. Nginx

  ```
  /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx
  ```

10. Nginx

  ```
  #
  [root@localhost ~]# /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx
  #/
  [root@localhost ~]# /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx -s stop(quitreload)
  #
  [root@localhost ~]# /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx -h
  #
  [root@localhost ~]# /usr/local/nginx/sbin/nginx -t
  #
  [root@localhost ~]# vim /usr/local/nginx/conf/nginx.conf
  ```

11. Nginx

  ```
  whereis nginx
  ```

12. Nginx

  ```
  [root@localhost conf]# cd /usr/local/nginx/conf/
  [root@localhost conf]# vim nginx.conf
  ```

13. http

  ```
  upstream test.com{
    server 192.168.17.133:80 weight=5;
    server 192.168.17.134:80 weight=1;
  }
  ```

14. http->serverlocation

  ```
  location / {
    proxy_pass  http://test.com;
    proxy_set_header Host       $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP  $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    root   html;
    index  index.html index.htm;
  }
  ```

15. rzsz

  ```
  yum install lrzsz
  ```

### yumnginx()

> yumnginx`/etc/yum.repos.d/nginx.repo`yum

```
vim /etc/yum.repos.d/nginx.repo
```

> 

```
[nginx]
name=nginx repo
baseurl=http://nginx.org/packages/centos/$releasever/$basearch/
gpgcheck=0
enabled=1
```

> nginx

```
yum list | grep nginx
yum install -y nginx
```


## Keepalived
### Keepalived
```
wget http://www.keepalived.org/software/keepalived-1.2.24.tar.gz
tar -zxvf keepalived-1.2.24.tar.gz
cd keepalived-1.2.24
./configure --prefix=/usr/local/keepalived
make && make install
```

> \
!!! OpenSSL is not properly installed on your system. !!!\
!!! Can not include OpenSSL headers files.\
yum -y install openssl-devel

> yum

```
yum install keepalived
```

### Keepalived
keepalived/etc/keepalivedkeepalived.conf/etc/keepalived

```

```

```

getenforce
/usr/sbin/sestatus -v
#
setenforce 0
#

#SELINUX=enforcingSELINUX=disabled
```

Post.title: Nginxproxy_passrewrite
Post._content:
## proxy_passrewrite

### proxy_pass

```
Syntax:     proxy_pass URL;
Default:    
Context:    location, if in location, limit_except
```

1. url

2. serverURI()

3. httphttps

4. IPeg
  
  ```
  proxy_pass http://localhost:8000/uri/;
  ```

5.  server groupnginxupstream, eg:
  
  ```
  upstream backend {
    server backend1.example.com       weight=5;
    server backend2.example.com:8080;
    server unix:/tmp/backend3;
 
    server backup1.example.com:8080   backup;
    server backup2.example.com:8080   backup;
  }
 
  server {
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://backend;
    }
  }
  ```

6. server nameport  URIeg

  ```
  proxy_pass http://$host$uri;
  ```

  nginxserver groupsupstreamserverserver namednsURIserver
    
  6.1. proxy_passURLURIlocationURIproxy_passURLURIeg

    ```
    location /name/ {
        proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1/remote/;
    }
    # http://127.0.0.1/name/test.html http://127.0.0.1/remote/test.html
    ```

  6.2. proxy_passURLURIURIservereg

    ```
    location /name/ {
        proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1;
    }
    #http://127.0.0.1/name/test.html http://127.0.0.1/name/test.html
    ```

  6.3. URI
    1. locationproxy_passURI
    2. proxy_passrewriteproxy_passeg:
      ```
      location /name/ {
        rewrite    /name/([^/]+) /users?name=$1 break;
        proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1;
      }
      ```
    
### rewrite

```
syntax:     rewrite regex replacement [flag]
Default:    
Context:    server, location, if
```

- regexURIrequest URIURIreplacement
- rewrite
- flag
- replacementhttp://, https://, or $schemeclient
- replacementrequestreplacementeg

  ```
  rewrite ^/users/(.*)$ /show?user=$1? last;=
  ```

- regex} or ;

flag
- last
    1. URIlocation
    2. rewriteserverlocation
    3. 10nginx500
    4. 302 http 
    5. url
- break
    1. location
    2. 302 http 
    3. url
- redirect
    1. 302 http
    2. url
- permanent
    1. 301 http
    2. url

Post.title: Zookeeper
Post._content:
## jdk1.8
> centOSjdk

```
rpm -qa|grep java
mkdir /usr/java/
mv jdk-8u161-linux-x64.tar.gz /usr/java/
tar zxvf jdk-8u161-linux-x64.tar.gz
mv jdk1.8.0_161/ jdk1.8
```

> 

```
vim /etc/profile

JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.8
CLASSPATH=$JAVA_HOME/lib/
PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin
export PATH JAVA_HOME CLASSPATH

source /etc/profile
```

## zookeeper

```
mkdir /usr/zookeeper/
mv zookeeper-3.4.11.tar.gz /usr/zookeeper/
tar zxvf zookeeper-3.4.11.tar.gz
cd zookeeper-3.4.11
cd conf
cp zoo_sample.cfg zoo.cfg
```

> zookeeperzookeeper

```
groupadd zookeeper
useradd -g zookeeper zookeeper
```

> 

```
chown -R zookeeper zookeeper-3.4.11
chgrp -R zookeeper zookeeper-3.4.11
```

> datalogs

```
cd /usr/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.4.11
mkdir data
mkdir logs
```

> /usr/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.4.11/confzoo.cfg

```
# The number of milliseconds of each tick
# zookeeper 
tickTime=2000
# The number of ticks that the initial
# synchronization phase can take
initLimit=10
# The number of ticks that can pass between
# sending a request and getting an acknowledgement
syncLimit=5
# the directory where the snapshot is stored.
# do not use /tmp for storage, /tmp here is just
# example sakes.
# dataDir=/tmp/zookeeper
 
# 
dataDir=/usr/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.4.11/data
 
# 
dataLogDir=/usr/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.4.11/logs
 
# the port at which the clients will connect
#  zookeeper 
clientPort=2181
 
# the maximum number of client connections.
# increase this if you need to handle more clients
#maxClientCnxns=60
#
# Be sure to read the maintenance section of the
# administrator guide before turning on autopurge.
#
# http://zookeeper.apache.org/doc/current/zookeeperAdmin.html#sc_maintenance
#
# The number of snapshots to retain in dataDir
#autopurge.snapRetainCount=3
# Purge task interval in hours
# Set to "0" to disable auto purge feature
#autopurge.purgeInterval=1
```

> 

```
vim /etc/profile

JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.8
ZOOKEEPER_HOME=/usr/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.4.11
CLASSPATH=$JAVA_HOME/lib/
PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin:$ZOOKEEPER_HOME/bin
export PATH JAVA_HOME CLASSPATH

source /etc/profile
```

### zookeeper

```
zkServer.sh start
zkServer.sh stop
zkServer.sh status
zkServer.sh restart
```

### zookeeper

> 

```
mv zoo.cfg zoo.cfg.standalone
grep -v "^$" zoo.cfg.standalone | grep -v "^#" > zoo.cfg
```

> 

```
tickTime=2000
initLimit=10
syncLimit=5
dataDir=/usr/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.4.11/data
dataLogDir=/usr/zookeeper/zookeeper-3.4.11/logs
clientPort=2181
server.1=192.168.17.133:2888:3888
server.2=192.168.17.134:2888:3888
server.3=192.168.17.135:2888:3888
```

> datadirmyidserver.

```
echo 1 > data/myid
echo 2 > data/myid
echo 3 > data/myid
```

> zookeeper

```
systemctl stop firewalld.service
systemctl disable firewalld.service
firewall-cmd --state
```

### zookeeper

 | 
---|---
zkCleanup | Zookeeper
zkCli | ZooKeeper
zkEvn | ZooKeeper
zkServer | ZooKeeper
